page.title: 04Religion
page.content: The 115 members of Keig, the smallest of the three churches, are to be congratulated on being self supporting, admirable in a country parish with one shop and a primary school with less than 20 pupils. The Church with its valuable pipe organ is much admired by visitors. Mrs. Agnes Ledingham has been a faithful organist for over 40 years and Church and Hall are well cared for by the Beadle,Mr Fred Laird. Women now share in the work of the Kirk Session and Board and there is a small but active Woman's Guild. Church services, once every two weeks, are as well supported as in any other country parish by the faithfull members. On 13 October 1985 a special service was held to celebrate the 150th. anniversary of Keig Church.
